page.title: 05The Church,Stoke-by-Clare :1
page.content: The Church dates back to the 16th century but it incorporates parts of an earlier church.Looking west from the chancel step part of the arch of an earlier nave can be seen on the tower wall.This earlier church probably consisted of only a nave,chancel and the existing tower.The south wall of the nave became the south wall of a new south aisle when the church was rebuilt in its present form. The tower has a battlemented parapet and a belfry with six bells dated 1786. There is a clock with an hour hand only which tradition says was made by the village blacksmith in 1490 but is probably about 1670.A smaller bell on top of the tower strikes the hours and is said to have been the chapel bell of Stoke Priory. {continued}
